messages: f109a63709e702ed304a85e971b0f710 (00:27): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, checking for it in CSSOM?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:36): f109a63709e702ed304a85e971b0f710: CSSOM wouldn't expose this as far as i can tell
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:36): f109a63709e702ed304a85e971b0f710: since 'transparent' is the default
f109a63709e702ed304a85e971b0f710 (00:52): but transparent wouldn't be the default if it weren't supported, would it?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:55): Wouldn't it be treated as #00a000 if the keyword wasn't supported, or something like that?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:56): oooh, good point

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:56): Compare http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/?%3Cbody%20bgcolor%3Dtransparent%3E vs http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/?%3Cbody%20bgcolor%3Dtransparenx%3E
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:56): indeed
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:56): ok
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:56): In IE6, the former looks white, the latter looks #0000e0
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:57): so can anyone think of a way in which browsers differe in their handling of <body bgcolor=""> (empty) and <body bgcolor="transparent">?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:59): http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/?%3Cstyle%3Ehtml%7Bbackground%3Ablue%7D%3C%2Fstyle%3E%0D%0A%3Cbody%20bgcolor%3D%22transparent%22%3E
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:59): In IE6 it looks white
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:59): (whereas bgcolor="" looks blue)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:02): well making it map to body { background: transparent; } isn't going to solve that problem...
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:05): I see quite a number of pages with bgcolor=transparent
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:06): mostly on table elements, not body
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:06): but http://windows.radified.com/ has it on body
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:06): Can someone try emailing me a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554.com?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:17): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: can you find a difference between bgcolor="" and bgcolor="Transparent" on <table>?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:17): the bgcolor=transparent on that site seems useless
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:18): risks getting even more hated by the rdf community

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:23): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/?%3Cstyle%3Etr%7Bbackground%3Ayellow%7D%3C%2Fstyle%3E%0D%0A%3Cbody%20bgcolor%3Dblue%3E%0D%0A%3Ctable%3E%3Ctr%3E%3Ctd%20bgcolor%3D%22%22%3EA%3Ctd%20bgcolor%3Dtransparent%3EB%3C%2Ftable%3E
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:23): That's not table, but it's close :-)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:23): throws 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e some hatred
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:28): (http://philip.html5.org/data/bgcolor-transparent.txt is all the bgcolor="transparent"s that I see)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:28): (and http://philip.html5.org/data/bgcolors.txt is counts of total occurrences of values)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:29): sees a bgcolor="#(hex code here)"
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:29): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Can you get the latter list ignoring all conforming values
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:30): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: I don't know what's conforming
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:30): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: but you could easily work it out and filter the list yourself :-)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:30): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: See: HTML 5
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:30): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: No, I'm lazy.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:30): :)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:30): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Me too :-p
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:30): I know :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:30): I knew it was in vain.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:31): Hmm, maybe I should have sorted the bgcolor list in a proper ordering rather than whatever fancy English collation it's doing by default
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:32): uploads a new version of bgcolors.txt, now with all the #s grouped together, which is much more sensible
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:35): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: what does IE do with that test case?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:36): A double-backflip while whistling the Star Spangled Banner?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:36): hopes that's the correct reference
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:36): btw the live dom viewer now has a "save" button that gives you a "short" url
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:36): feel free to use it
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:37): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: The A cell has a yellow background, the B cell has a blue background (i.e. matching the body background)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:38): oh lordy
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:38): that's... uh... non-trivial to emulate
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:38): luckily the other browsers don't do it...

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:39): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: If I use the short URLs, and then your server crashes or is shut down and the short URL database is lost, then the whole future of humanity will be denied the knowledge of my tests
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:39): it's true
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:40): i can expose the database if you like... :-)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:40): whereas if I paste the long URL into IRC then it'll be copied into lots of people's private logs, and the web logs and caches and suchlike
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:40): thus saving our grandchildren from such deprivation of knowledge
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:40): fair enough :-)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:41): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Nah, exposing it would probably just be a waste of time :-p
